first_line: I never have nightmares,
line1: I always have day dreams
line2: The problem that always scares
line3: Is that I don't know what that means!

title: MY ZOOOTCH (Every Thing On It)
first_line: I never have nightmares,
line1: Though I dream every night.
line2: The monsters visit me and no one cares
line3: I am the one to give them a fright.

title: MY ZOOOTCH (Every Thing On It)
first_line: I never have nightmares,
line1: I sleep during the DAY.
line2: If I have a nightmare,
line3: It's best to stay away.

title: NOPE (Falling Up)
first_line: I put a piece of cantaloupe
line1: Underneath the microscrope
line2: and even though my mom said nope
line3: I quickly ate it, it was dope

title: NOPE (Falling Up)
first_line: I put a piece of cantaloupe
line1: the cantaloupe move to the edge
line2: there is my aunt with a microscope
line3: trying to tell me that is a veg

title: NOPE (Falling Up)
first_line: I put a piece of cantaloupe
line1: under the microscope to take a quick peek.
line2: Looking for the secret to the cantaloupe's sweetness, but nope,
line3: Its sweetness secrets I could not find, which makes me mope.

title: MY RULES (Where the Sidewalk Ends)
first_line: If you want to marry me, here’s what you’ll have to do:
line1: Be polite and thoughtful, following all the rules.
line2: I won't be troubled or wed by a grumpy rude man
line3: No, only a kind and caring soul will do.

title: MY RULES (Where the Sidewalk Ends)
first_line: If you want to marry me, here’s what you’ll have to do:
line1: You must learn how to make a perfect chicken-dumpling stew.
line2: And you must sew my holey socks,
line3: And soothe my troubled mind,

line1: You must learn how to make a perfect chicken-dumpling stew.

title: DIVING BOARD (Falling Up)
first_line: You’ve been up on that diving board
line1: Won't you take a dive?
line2: You've been on that diving board since dawn
line3: and it's 11:35.

title: DIVING BOARD (Falling Up)
first_line: You’ve been up on that diving board
line1: Looking to take a sharp dive
line2: And if you knew what all this was truly for
line3: You would have taken the slide

title: DIVING BOARD (Falling Up)
first_line: You’ve been up on that diving board
line1: You've been trying to learn how to use it.
line2: You've tried it all, eve tried asking the Lord.
line3: If you don't learn soon, you're going to lose it.

title: HAPPY ENDING? (Every Thing On It)
first_line: There are no happy endings.
line1: Only happy at the start.
line2: There can't be happy endings,
line3: Most endings will break your heart.

title: HAPPY ENDING? (Every Thing On It)
first_line: There are no happy endings.
line1: Life is one big continuous dream.
line2: It provides you a lot of vendings.
line3: But be careful, because nothing is as it seems.

title: HAPPY ENDING? (Every Thing On It)
first_line: There are no happy endings.
line1: To start, admit this is so
line2: But only complex blendings
line3: Of happy and sad we know.

title: YEARS FROM NOW (Every Thing On It)
first_line: Although I cannot see your face
line1: I know a special smile is there,
line2: I hear the laughing in your voice,
line3: It reminds me how much you care.

title: YEARS FROM NOW (Every Thing On It)
first_line: Although I cannot see your face
line1: As you flip these poems awhile
line2: Somewhere from some far-off place
line3: I hear you laughing--and I smile.

title: YEARS FROM NOW (Every Thing On It)
first_line: Although I cannot see your face
line1: I feel the lines in your smile.
line2: I know you're full of grace,
line3: And laughing every mile.
